result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Vannessa M Lees in court with attorney Raymond Charles Gamez.  Michael Patrick White appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Carolyn Kingsley.
State moves to DRI the charges.
BTC: Case DRI.

Defendant Vannessa M Lees in court with attorney Raymond Charles Gamez.  Michael Patrick White appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Carolyn Kingsley.
Defense requets adjournment. 
BTC: PLEAS date set 
  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 16, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Vannessa M Lees in court with attorney Raymond Charles Gamez.  Michael Patrick White appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Carolyn Kingsley.
Deft has picked up new charges in case 16CM388.
BTC: Matter adjourned, Deft to be tested today after court and one more time before her next court appearance.  Status conference scheduled for March 28, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Vannessa M Lees in court with attorney Raymond Charles Gamez.  Michael Patrick White appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Carolyn Kingsley.
Matter is scheduled on the Court's Motion to review bond.
Deft is non compliant with ZCI.
Argument made by Defense.
State is requesting that bond be modified.
BTC: Modify bond in case 15CM1637 to $500 cash, all other conditions remain.
 
 ***DEFENDANT TAKEN INTO CUSTODY ON CASE 15CM1637***

Defendant Vannessa M Lees in court with attorney Raymond Charles Gamez.  Matthew J Hastings appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Leslie Johnson.
Def is requesting a short adjournment.
State has extended an offer.
BTC: Matter adjourned, deft must go to ZCI after court today.  Status conference scheduled for February 22, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  Do not drive unless properly licensed.  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  You have been ordered to have your fingerprints/photographs taken as a condition of your bond.  Report to the Sheriff's Office Records Bureau. Hours:  Tuesdays, Wednesdays and Thursday between 9:00 a.m. and 11:00 a.m. or between 1:00 p.m. and 4:00 p.m.  Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Vannessa M Lees in court with attorney Dirk Christian Jensen.  Erika Frank Motsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Carolyn Kingsley.
  Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, p-ng, bond set.  Status conference scheduled for January 11, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Vannessa M Lees in court.  Erika Frank Motsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Carolyn Kingsley.
Deft did go to the SPD's office on 10/9/15 and was found eligible.
State is requesting an adjournment for atty to be present.
BTC: Matter adjourned.  Status conference scheduled for November 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.
